title: National Park Week, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump, declaring April 19 through April 27, 2025, as National Park Week. It emphasizes the importance of national parks as symbols of American heritage, celebrating their beauty and historical significance. The proclamation marks the 250th anniversary of the Battles of Lexington and Concord, highlighting events at Minute Man National Historical Park that honor the bravery of American patriots. 

The President underscores actions taken to restore park names to honor American greatness, including renaming Mount McKinley, and announces the creation of the National Garden of American Heroes. The proclamation encourages Americans to learn about and appreciate their natural and historical heritage, promoting education on patriotism and history through initiatives like the White House Task Force on Celebrating America's 250th Birthday. 

Overall, the proclamation aims to inspire citizens to cherish and protect national parks for future generations while reflecting on their role in American identity.
